result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Stocks Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 298 Days.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution:  $150.00 in Case #14CM1317 and Andrew W.; $170.00 in Case #14CM1318 to La Belle Motel and Walinda A.  Remaining restitution: $1,000.00 in Case #14CM1317 to Edward S; in this Case $546.40 to Shannon M.; and $1,391.61 to Jeff and Linda B.

To be paid with 25% of Prison earnings only and then at the rate of $50.00 per month starting the 4th month of Extended Supervision as a Condition of Extended Supervision - To Be Paid First, then the Court Costs and Surcharge
To be paid after Restitutuion is Paid In Full.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Within the First 6 months of Extended Supervision obtain a valid driver's license.
No contact with any of the victims in the read in files or convictions files.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Cases:  #13CF1034, #14CF208, #14CF824, #14CM1317, #14CM1318 and #13CT1229 were Dismissed and Read into Case #14CF209 and #14CF827.
